name: P3 Aqua
blurb: Preserve, Predict and Protect our Oceans
text: using real-time satellite analytics, predictive models, and realistic visualizations the P3 Aqua application allows government planners, emergency responders, and industry to collaborate over environmental scenarios.

name: Algae Explorer
text: using data from the European Space Agency Sentinel-3 satellite, chlorophyll levels are used to approximate algae concentrations in our coastal waters. This project is continuing with predictive models that were started as part of a Microsoft AI for Earth award.

name: Vic Stories
blurb: Interactive Fiction for the Victoria Film Festival
text: The film festival delights and engages audiences every year, and we're trying to turn consumers of stories into creators by using the Ink interactive fiction environment to allow people to write stories about the films that inspire them.

name: Urban Planning
text: One of the students in the lab went to Toronto to sit with ESRI for 3 months, while we helped him design a project to collaboratively tackle urban planning problems on a touch table using the Unity gaming engine. These design charrettes involve multiple people and complex geospatial decisions.

name: VR Tsunami
text: In this project, presented at Siggraph 2019 and used in classrooms across BC, we developed a series of interactive games and simulations to teach middle school students about ocean science and tsunamis. Using accurate Digital Elevation Models and hydrodynamic simulations we created a Unity game to explore the impact of various near-field earthquake scenarios.

name: EOC of the Future
blurb: Reimagining Emergency Response: a vision demo for the UN
text: The UN Office of Outer Space Affairs had a session on satellite analytics for emergency response at which we were asked to prepare a vision demo of how augmented reality and collaborative analytics could re-imagine the process of emergency response. The more info link below will allow you to see that demo.
client: Emergency Management BC, Ocean Networks Canada, UN Office of Outer Space Affairs

name: NalPal
text: In an opiate overdose seconds mean the difference between life and death. Many people now carry naloxone kits which can reverse the acute effects of an overdose, but if you see an overdose and don't have a kit how do you find someone? Nalpal was a project to attempt to fill that gap.

name: BC Stories
text: The Royal BC Museum worked with us to create interactive Unity games in Virtual Reality that explored the museum collections. In collaboration with the Centre for Digital Media in Vancouver and the Technical University of Berlin, QVirt and students at the University of Victoria created two narratives about the BC gold rush to go alongside an exhibit at the museum.

name: Algorithm Test Kitchen
text: QVirt worked with a master's student and developers at UrtheCast to create an application on Amazon Web Services that allowed GIS developers to write python scripts that took advantage of containerization and a map-reduce algorithm to execute their algorithms on many compute nodes on AWS to allow fast and seamless collaboration for algorithm development.
